Articles.Content:
Before you ask in the replies, I already got a two of them answered:

1. Is this like Career mode?

Naw, Career is like "Do this at x height and at x biome." I hope that unlike career won't be very strict but still gives you a good idea of what's wanted. 

2. Who's direct to this challenge?

Anyone (hopefully.) The challenge is to build on previous missions and hopefully enjoy doing so

Alright let's get started

Community Space Agency

The goal of community space agency is to bring the best engineers to build and fly missions

Steps in order how to do this:

1. List your fake companies' name, public or private, favorite color, and founder (your username or real name [IF YOU DON'T CARE PEOPLE KNOWING])

here is an example

////

Company name: ExampleX

Status: Homeless

Favorite color: Vector

Founder: Some guy on the street

                                                        \\\

2. What would your companies' patch style be like:

Here is the templates (examples from the real world)

Simple:

Spoiler

21st:

Spoiler

Classic:

Spoiler

Make sure that you send in your preferences with your submission

3. Start launching those contracts

Now you can start launching rockets and completing contracts. You will get a due date, requirements, recomendations, funds, and the mission reputation.

Here is an example of a contract (example mission available soon)

///

Spoiler

Contract expiration date: 6/24/2011

Mission requirements:

A homeless shelter for space krakens have been issued to your company. The destination has been targeted to Bop. You have 2 kerbin years to launch a homeless shelter, land it on Bop and broadcast at least one science module. The shelter must look like a house. The house must have a staff of at least 2 kerbals. The house must be able to communicate to KSC and be able land in one piece. The ability to return to kerbin and/or to have a vehicle on site are not required but pleased to have.

Recommendations:

This mission is recommended to someone who has at least has completed more than 6 CSA missions and has experience launching interplanetary missions. Aesthetic skills are heavily recommended.

Funds:

You will receive 500,000 funds to complete this mission

Mission reputation:

-You will get a tier class 5 patch (look below to see what that looks like)

-Your company will be more noticed

-You will earn 500 basic points if mission is completed to basic requirements (look below for further details)

\\\

4. Reputation, patches, and ranking

Now that you have submitted a mission (by photos or video.) We now get to the nice stuff

1. Reputation, if this challenge get's big enough; I will start making montages of the monthly missions

2. Patches, you get custom patches for every mission, I will make them better based on the tier (NOTE EXAMPLES ARE FROM NASA AND I AM NOT TRYING TO CRITICIZE THEM)

///

Spoiler

Tier one: Some simple logo where it's mostly made of shapes

Tier two: Some spacecraft looks to it

Tier three: Creative shapes to it

Tier four: Awesome details

Tier five: Your spacecraft and some cool background (example from my smaller challenge)

Tier six: The best quality

\\\

3. Ranking

You get points based on what you do in your mission. The more missions you do the more points. The better you do your missions the more points. If your mission doesn't meet the requirements, then you lose points based on the severity. My judging is what determine's final points (though community judging will also be welcomed)

5. Rules and Answers

Now the boring part (READ CAREFULLY!!!! THERE IS IMPORTANT INFO HERE!!!!!! MOST QUESTIONS CAN BE ANSWERED HERE!!!!!)

///

Spoiler

Remember, that I can make whatever type of patch you want and if you don't accept it is for you to decide. Due to my time restrictions, it might be a while before I get to your questions, patches, or contracts. Depending on how big this challenge becomes, I might start adding restrictions on contracts. If you miss the due date, your contract is expired and your contract is returned to the board. Cheats are not allowed unless it's mentioned to be allowed in the requirements description. Mods are generally not accepted unless mentioned to be allowed in requirements description. Recovered funds (while help increase your points,) will not allow for spacecraft costing over your budget. Going over budget usually goes to less points. You get the green on your contract if I approve so. Depending on the contract, only one or more can do the mission. Usually, it's first come first serve on contracts. You can apply contracts by replying down in the comments. I will accept by usually doing a "Your good to go @da username." Some missions (like an Eve spaceship mission) can be requested to extend the submission date by DM-ing me. As of 2020, you can do your missions in KSP 1 and if your a developer and submit something by KSP 2, it is welcomed (and exciting if you do too!) Your save of KSP must be beyond KSP 1.3 as this is when realistic re-entry heating was added. If you accept a contract that is impossible to do via your current save, you may not use mods to complete it (Ex: You accept doing a Comet mission but you don't have comets then you can't go find a mod to add them.) DLC parts are allowed. Returning contracts happen either by missing due date or you requesting for them to be returned. Make sure you put @The Doodling Astronaut in there so that I don't miss it. The difference of Public and Private is that peeps working on the same contract can donate to others for public. INTEGRITY COUNTS ON MISSIONS!!!!! The amount of Contracts vary from time to time.

\\\

Now for: 

THE BOARD

Available contracts:

Easy:

To the Mun! ∞ left!

Spoiler

Contract expiration date: 13/32/-20

Mission Requirements:

The easiest contract available. Test your skills! Land on the mun! Basic rules apply. You get to decide how much crew your bring

Mission recommendations:

For beginners. 

Funds:

Work with 60,000 funds

Mission reputation:

-you get no patch for this

-you get 20 points

no more available... YET

Medium:

Base camp Munvrest! 3 left!

Spoiler

Contract expiration date: 7/11/20

Mission requirements: 

It's been decided that to explore the southern poles of the Mun, a base camp should be placed. This base camp has to land on the tallest point on the mun (look below for reference)! You have 20 days to launch your base camp to the mun. The base camp is required to have 5 kerbals staffed and have a science module. The base camp must also have a rover. Base camp should also be able to have power, have the ability for kerbals to explore on surface, and communication with KSC either by relay or direct. Flight assisting mods used are allowed.

Recommendations:

It is recommended to someone who has made a base camp before or knows how to precisely land in one location. 

Funds:

You get 1,000,00 funds to complete this mission

Reputation:

- You will get a tier-five patch

- You will get 500 points

- You will be able to use your new base camp in expansion missions later on

Resources:

no more available... YET

Hard:

none available... YET

Current Ranking

1. 0 missions completed and 0 points

2. -

3. -

4. -

5. -

And as always I will be down in the comments to help with questions 

Now let's go to

SPAAAAAAACCCCEEEE

Edited June 20, 2020 by Guest

"I am taking a Base Camp Munvrest contract! @The Doodling Astronaut, so there is now 3 left for taking. My company is The Doodling Company"

Now I wait for me to respond

"Alright we have you recorded for Base Camp Munvrest contract. Thanks @The Doodling Astronaut for partcipating"

Now I can work on my mission

<Wait here I have not completed the mission yet!>
